channel.title: Python on Naresh Chaurasia
channel.description: Recent content in Python on Naresh Chaurasia

item.title: Introduction to Linux
item.description: Linux is a powerful open-source operating system widely used in servers, cloud environments, networking, and software development. It provides stability, security, and flexibility, making it the backbone of many enterprise systems. For beginners, learning Linux is essential to understand how servers, applications, and infrastructure run in real-world IT environments. Introduction to Linux Getting Started Essential Commands Working with Processes File System Management Shell Scripting Basics User and Group Management Networking Basics Package Management 1.

item.title: Python Advanced
item.description: Python is a simple, easy-to-learn programming language that’s perfect for beginners. It uses clean, readable syntax that feels like writing plain English, making it a great first language for anyone new to coding. In the beginning, you’ll learn how to install Python on your computer, explore popular code editors like VS Code and PyCharm, and write your very first Python program. You’ll also understand how Python code runs, how to use the Python interpreter, and get comfortable with basic tools that make coding fun and efficient.

item.title: Python Selenium

Handling Web Elements 6. Advanced Python for Selenium 7. Advanced Selenium Techniques 8. Data-Driven Testing 9. Selenium with PyTest Framework 10. Page Object Model (POM) and Design Patterns 11. Cross-Browser and Parallel Testing 12. Continuous Integration and Reporting 13. Best Practices and Optimization 14. Project: End-to-End Test Automation 15.
